channel.title: Server very lagging
channel.description: Me server is very lagging if there are 10 people`s online, i`m using a project czar based source, and i got 18GB RAM i dont know why i am lagging.

Its also about client size I think I had project czar could online hold 15 players untill lagg now I use dodian and can have 4times the amount of players

item.title: Server very lagging
item.dc:creator: @crackheadKD crackheadKD
item.description:
@crackheadKD wrote:

Um, hello?? Has anyone ever thought of bandwidth?
Connections between other computers doesn’t have shit to do with ram… its all on the capabilities of your internet.
Maybe you should upgrade your internet package. Ask for a plan that allows more bandwidth.
If you don’t know what I’m talking about…
Google

Read full topic

item.title: Server very lagging
item.dc:creator: @Coder_X Coder X
item.description:
@Coder_X wrote:

Ram does make a difference, but what makes a greater difference is how properly programmed your server is. I’ve held over 96 people no lagg before, on a server.

Then on another i lagged when it was just me.

Read full topic

@jme wrote:

It’s probably nothing to do with your “18 gb computer”

It more than likely has to do with the fact that all of your servers are complete crap, and not programmed properly.

Learn java and fix it.

item.title: Server very lagging
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

BORED:

Me server is very lagging if there are 10 peoples online, im using a project czar based source, and i got 18GB RAM i dont know why i am lagging.

It’s not all about RAM. It’s also about CPU speed, number of cores etc? What are the stats there?

[quote=“MrMoney, post:2, topic:192448”]You don’t have 18 gb of ram
that’s far ahead of what your comp can handle[/quote]

If you’ve got a 64-bit PC, you could potentially handle up to 17179869184 GB of RAM (2^64/1024/1024/1024), as opposed to 4GB (2^32/1024/1024/1024) with a 32-bit PC.

Also, another thing that can help. In lots of servers there is a “System.gc()” called in the server loop (in server.java). I would remove this, or only call it every 100 or 1000 loops. Garbage collecting in the main loop of a program (even if there are threads) can have an impact on performance. In fact, it’s best to only garbage collect after you have done something where you have allocated a lot of memory and no longer need to use it. Also, if you do have 18GB of RAM it will be a less important operation ;).

Read full topic
